alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 11:32AM CDT until April 05 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chilton and Coosa. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 AM CDT, Doppler radar rainfall estimates and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain from previous thunderstorms are creating rises in area streams and creeks. This will cause small stream flooding. - The Walnut Creek area is the most likely place to experience minor flooding however many streams within this advisory are elevated. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clanton, Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Lyle, Moriah, Dollar, Bentleyville, Higgins Ferry Park, Pentonville, Mitchell Lake, Hanover, Crewsville, Cottage Grove, Verbena, Nixburg, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Hatchet, Bradford and Gap Of The Mountain.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
